III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth E’s mother is not allowed to bring her food.
Investigation Youth E, age 18, is a former resident of Vista Maria’s Myriam Hall.
The program is designed for youth transitioning out of the juvenile
or foster care system. Youth E was discharged to her mother
shortly after these allegations were made.
I received information from Government Worker 1 that
Complainant, also Youth J’s mother, is hyperverbal and unable to
focus while communicating. During a previous investigation
involving her daughter, Complainant sent the worker 88 texts, and
numerous unrequested photos and documents. It is suspected
Complainant may have serious mental health issues. For this
reason, I did not contact her to elicit additional information or
concerns.
I interviewed Therapist with Rights Officer present. She has
worked for the agency for 12 years. Therapist stated Youth E’s
mother is allowed to bring and has brought her daughter food.
I interviewed Youth E with Rights Officer present. She said her
mother brought fast food, dry noodles, snack cakes and soda to
her at the facility.
Analysis Youth E's mother is allowed and has brought her daughter food.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
2

Rule Code & Rule 400.4122 Resident and parent visitation
Section (1) An institution shall provide for visits between each resident and
Description the resident’s parents, unless parental rights have been
terminated or the resident’s record contains documentation that
visitation is detrimental to the resident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth E’s mother must make appointments to visit.
Investigation Youth E’s Therapist stated that Vista Maria’s protocol is that visits
are by appointment only.
I reviewed Vista Maria’s visitor policy. It indicates that visits are by
appointment and should be made at least 24 hours in advance.
Analysis It is protocol at Vista Maria that parental visits are by appointment
only.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(c) Documentation of medical care and maintenance of health
records.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth E’s medication is frequently changed implying changes are
made without consent. Youth E and her mother are not allowed to
know her Lithium dose.
Investigation I interviewed Youth E with Rights Officer present on 5/4/23. She
was referred by the Community Management Organization (CMO)
Insight for placement at Vista Maria. Youth E said she would like
to take Motrin, but it is not prescribed. Rights Officer explained
that her doctor advised against it due to interactive side effects
with other medication. Youth E agreed to discuss the matter with
her doctor at her next medication review. I asked if Youth E knew
her dose of Lithium. She replied, “I take 300 mg of Lithium once a
day at night.”
3

I reviewed Youth E’s psychotropic medication consent form dated
4/24/23. It should be noted Youth E turned 18, thus she signed
the consent form herself attesting her psychiatrist talked to her
about her medications and she had a chance to ask questions.
Youth E signed the form again on 4/25/23 giving voluntary
consent to the treatment plan and indicating she agreed with the
doctor’s recommendations.
Therapist said Youth E’s mother is allowed to know and does
know her daughter’s Lithium dose. “It was discussed with her at
medication reviews on 4/13/23 and 4/19/23.”
Analysis Proper consents accompany all medication changes. Youth E,
age 18, and signed consent form acknowledging she agreed with
the changes and had an opportunity to ask questions.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Another youth attempted to hit Youth E with a chair implying a lack
of staff supervision.
Investigation Youth E stated a youth threw a chair and it did not hit her. She
said staff were present and got between her and the chair.
I reviewed an incident report by Staff 1 dated 4/25/23. It indicated
Youth E was yelling at Youth D from across the room. Initially
Youth D responded verbally. Staff 1 attempted to deescalate the
situation. Youth E left the room but continued commenting so
Youth D could hear. Youth D threw the dining room chair on the
floor and walked out of the unit. Youth E called her mother about
the incident. Her mother told Staff 1 she would “file a police
report, hire a detective, file a restraining order and get Youth D
thrown out of there.”
4

I reviewed video of this incident. Youths D and B are sitting in the
dining room and Youth E is standing gesturing at them from
across the room. Youths D and B respond to Youth E verbally.
Youth E goes into another room. Youth D picks up a chair and
holds it for several seconds. Staff 1 is talking to Youth D. Youth
D drops the chair on the floor and walks away.
Analysis Video shows Youth D did not throw a chair at anyone. Staff 1 was
present and supervising when the incident occurred.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4112 Staff qualifications
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth E’s Therapist is misadvising her to get her own apartment.
Requested information is being held from Youth E’s mother. Law
enforcement was called on Youth E’s mother implying Vista Maria
staff called them and the call was unjustified.
Investigation Youth E said Therapist did advise her to move into her own
apartment after discharge. Youth E, on the other hand, wants to
live with her mother. When the time comes, she acknowledged
the decision will be made through a collaborative effort involving
the court.
Therapist admitted she did offer Youth E getting her own
apartment as an option after discharge along with several other
options to consider.
Therapist denied withholding requested information from Youth
E’s mother. However, she said Youth E’s mother did ask her to
write a letter indicating that Youth E is not a temporary court ward.
Therapist refused to write the letter because Youth E is a
temporary court ward.
I reviewed an incident report by Staff 2 dated 5/1/23. It indicated
Youth E’s mother had a visit scheduled for 4pm, however, she
arrived at the security gate at 1:30pm demanding access. Youth
E’s mother threatened the security guard she would call Dearborn
Heights police to escort her onto campus. By 2:45pm, the mother
5

had called the police and an officer arrived at the gate. The officer
asked Staff 2 to brief him on the situation. After the briefing, due
to the mother’s irate behaviors and argumentative tone, the officer
recommended that Vista Maria cancel her scheduled visit at 4pm.
Therapist observed Youth E’s mother shows signs of paranoia,
disorganized thoughts, and a psychotic thought pattern. In terms
of calling the police, she said no one from Vista Maria called them.
The youth’s mother called the police herself.
Analysis There is no evidence Therapist is misadvising Youth E or
withholding requested information from her mother. No staff from
Vista Maria called law enforcement on Youth E's mother. Youth
E's mother called law enforcement herself.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
